p: Leaf extracts and essential oils from O. europaea have been reported to have antimicrobial activities against many microorganisms including bacteria, viruses, fungi and parasites. While research has shown that the plant does not have broad spectrum antimicrobial activity it has been shown to be potent against some Gram positive and Gram negative bacteria such as Staphylococcus aureus and Escherichia coli respectively [ 10]. Antimicrobial activity has also been shown against fungi such as Candida albicans and Cryptococcus neoformans while other researches have reported the antimicrobial activity of the plant against Helicobacter pylori, Campylobacter jejuni, Bacillus subtilis and Pseudomonas aeruginosa [ 9].
